artist: Artist: Jacques  Le Chevallier; Artist: René Koechlin
creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
description: Aluminum with adjustable hood vents; ebonite top and foot
image_copyright: © Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York %2F ADAGP%2C Paris
text: Jacques Le Chevallier’s  lamps were meant to shock. They are brazenly functional, showing off their machine-like construction of inelegant flat metal shapes held together by unconcealed screws. The angled panels act as light diffusers. Le Chevallier created at least seven lamp designs in the late 1920s and strove to make each one sculptural, functional, and unique.
title: Lampe à Pans Mobiles No. 40
